What happens to fees generated on a new blockchain when using Verus' cross-chain functionality?

Fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool on a new blockchain are earned on that new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This allows for seamless connectivity between blockchains.

in, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network and back, with all features and currencies of the public chain but none of the access. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. How do crowdfunding currency launches work on Verus, and what happens if minimum participation levels are not met?

On Verus, crowdfunding currency launches can be set up to require minimum levels of worldwide participation in specific currencies on the chain. If the minimum participation levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of their pre-conversions, minus network fees. This ensures that launches are successful and participants are protected.

How does Verus enable interoperability between blockchains, and what are the benefits of this?

Verus enables interoperability between blockchains through its multi-currency, multi-chain network, which allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. Notary IDs provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains to be available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains. This allows for unlimited scale and new use cases, with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization's internal private network and back.

Are there any limitations to the number of blockchains that can operate on the Verus network?

No, there is no limit to the number of blockchains that can continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network. While there may be some overhead for cross-notarization, the Verus blockchain network is designed to support an unlimited number of blockchains.
